___app.description: the app that produced this panel

_88status.description: The current disposition of an assessment

_88userInteractionUri.description: when present, a uri, with all query parameters urlencoded, of a small, iframe-able web page that the user (e.g. the recruiter) uses to interact with/view the assessment

_88userInteractionMessage.description: when present, a markdown formatted string that will be displayed to the user in the assessent popup. Any links open inside a new tab/window.

___userAttentionRequired.description: Signals that the assessment cannot proceed until the user provides some input. Can only be true when either userInteractionUri or userInteractionUri are non-null.

___candidateInteractionUri.description: when present, a uri, with all query parameters urlencoded, that the candidate must follow to complete some part of the assessment

_88imageUrl.description: url of an image that will be loaded from an  app into the assessment hub to represent an assessment's status or an unstarted assessment type

_88raisers.description: a list of every user who raised this assessment (this may be more than one, i.e. via linkages). Does not include linkages raised by the system, e.g. an assessment started because a candidate dropped into a bucket

___view.description: the key of the view instance that will give more details about the subject of this assessment (name, email address, job ID, etc.)

$eref.description: An array of all of the application views

___homePage.description: the homepage for this career site

___id.description: immutable id for this career site

___label.description: label for this career site, e.g. Graduate recruitment site

___app.description: Shortcode for the app that owns these assessment types

___appName.description: Name for the app that owns these assessment types

___url.description: a (probably tenant-specific) url of the landing page for this app

___label.description: label for this job board, e.g. Super grads

___logo.description: A url that contains the logo for your app

___defaultLegacySourceCode.description: a default for legacy source code when this board is installed, e.g. SK.

___defaultAdvertisementDuration.description: how many days do advertisement remain open on the site, e.g. 30

___defaultSetupErrorMessage.description: a default value for the installed board's setup error message. If not null, setup required will light up on the app for all new installs.

___domain.description: e.g. www.supergrads.com - used for source tracking

$eref.description: details of the social networks enabled by this tenant

___name.description: name of the network, e.g. LinkedIn

___icon.description: uri of a thumbnail image representing the social network

___uri.description: uri that a candidate can follow to connect to the social network

___url.description: url of the setup page, if one exists at this level (global, workflow or job)

___setupRequiredFlag.description: true if setup is currently required *and can be performed* at this level (global, workflow or job)

_88buckets.description: an ordered array of the buckets that are part of this workflow

$eref.description: the logical information needed to render a panel (content of an iframe)

___uri.description: the url that the iframe will be populated from

___testFlag.description: true if this set is to be applied as a dry run - i.e. no changes should be made to the jobs at the target

_88shortSummary.description: A short (up to 75 characters) and enticing call to action for candidates for this job

_88templateFlag.description: true if this job is a template, otherwise false/null/not present

_88country.description: a 2 letter country code for the job as per ISO 3166-1 alpha-2

_88title.description: A short phrase describing the position as it would be listed on a business card or in a company directory

_88org.description: the job's org (a value from GET /orgs)

_88code.description: A code, often used in advertisements and when referring to the job opening with candidates. Codes are expected to be unique within currently active job openings. Not in HR/XML

___availableExternally.description: Position is currently open to externals (implies status is active, but callers should check that relevant closeDates are in the future)

___internalPublishDate.description: the date on which the job was published to internal candidates. If not set, use publishDate.

___publishDate.description: the date on which the job was published (became available to candidates)

___externalPublishDate.description: the date on which the job was published to external candidates. If not set, use publishDate.

___availableInternally.description: Position is currently open to internals (implies status is active, but callers should check that relevant closeDates are in the future)

___internalCloseDate.description: the date on which applications from internal candidates are scheduled to close. If not set, closeDate is used.

___closeDate.description: the date on which applications are scheduled to close

___externalCloseDate.description: the date on which applications from external candidates are scheduled to close. If not set, closeDate is used.

_88description.description:
Formatted using a subset (no angle brackets) of markdown with individual lines demarcated with 
.

_88externalId.description: An immutable external identifier, e.g. primary key in an upstream system, used to identify the job

_88accessCode.description: a code that, if held on an incoming tracker, allows the holder to view and apply for the job even if it would otherwise be not visible to them

_88company.description: as per Salesforce, more explicit than org

___phase.description: Buckets have a phase, which represents the approximate part of the recruitment process this bucket is for - for example the phase 'interview' might have several buckets (e.g. 'line manager interview', etc.).

_88selectedId.description: the id of a choice that the user selected

_88pickChoice.description: the name of a choice that the user selected

___choice.description: the name of a choice that the user selected

___subItems.description: items unlocked based on a cascade choice

___url.description: a (probably tenant-specific) url of the landing page for this app

$eref.description: An array of actions rolled up across all producing apps
Details for a file upload operation

_88status.description: The current disposition of an assessment

_88launchDocument.description: a url-encoded json document containing start paramaters for this assessment, typically captured by the assessment type's launch UI

_88raisers.description: a list of every user who raised this assessment (i.e., via a linkage). Does not include linkages raised by the system, e.g. an assessment started because a candidate dropped into a bucket

_88assessedCompetency.description: A specified competency is a reference to a particular competency at a specified level of proficiency
_88assessedCompetency.title: Assessed Competency

_88userInteractionUri.description: when present, a uri of a small, iframe-able web page that the user (e.g. the recruiter) uses to interact with/view the assessment

_88attachmentType.description: Only one document with this name can be attached to an assessment result.
_88attachmentType.title: Name

___userAttentionRequired.description: Signals that the assessment cannot proceed until the user provides some input. Can only be true when userInteractionUri is non-null.

___candidateInteractionUri.description: when present, a uri that the candidate must follow to complete some part of the assessment

_88imageUrl.description: url of an image that will be loaded from an  app into the assessment hub to represent an assessment's status or an unstarted assessment type

___view.description: the key of the view instance that will give more details about the subject of this assessment (name, email address, job ID, etc.)

$eref.description: package of data for the tenant (e.g. via some trusted app like an ats) to update an assessment

___app.description: the app that can produce these actions

$eref.description: details of a single test

___runTime.description: Duration taken to run all the tests, displayed in seconds

___message.description: Details about the series of api tests completed. Also includes any exceptions

___success.description: True if all the tests passed correctly, otherwise false due to an api test or multiple api test failures

$eref.description: the result of successfully launching a job set upload

___uploadID.description: the ID of the successfully launched upload

_88notifications.description: whether this candidate wants to receive email alerts about new jobs

_88internalFlag.description: whether this candidate is an internal

$eref.description: details of a candidate's ability to apply for a given job

___notAllowedMessage.description: details of why the candidate is not allowed to apply - e.g. 'You've already applied'

___allowed.description: true of the candidate is allowed to apply for this job, otherwise false

___allInclusiveFlag.description: true if all nodes are present in the request (i.e. any nodes in the database but not in the request should be deactivated)

___testFlag.description: true if this set is to be applied as a dry run - i.e. no changes should be made to the jobs at the target

___allInclusiveFlag.description: true if all nodes are present in the request (i.e. any nodes in the database but not in the request should be deactivated)

___testFlag.description: true if this set is to be applied as a dry run - i.e. no changes should be made to the users at the target

$eref.description: An array of job boards with the apps that producing them

___app.description: the app that is hosting this job board

___testFlag.description: true if this set is to be applied as a dry run - i.e. no changes should be made to the category values at the target

_88domain.description: A complete domain name, used by this app (as installed by this tenant), with optional wildcard, e.g. https://*.myapp.com. If the wildcard * is used, it must be followed by a dot.

___settingsPage.description: a url of a settings page for this app. The setup page is where the user is led to after clicking [settings] in the UI. After setup is complete the app should redirect the user back to the passed in relayPage.

___domainsUsed.description: An array of domains that your app uses. The tenant's IT team can view this, rolled up with all other installed apps, in order to add to Trusted Sites in bulk.

___setupRequired.description: true if the app is unusable or degraded due to lack of some setup. When true, this causes the setup required indicator to appear next to the app in the UI. When true, the app should provide a value for settingsPage.

___landingPage.description: a (probably tenant-specific) url of the landing page for this app. The landing page is where the user is led to after clicking [open] in the UI.

$eref.description: package of data for an assessment app to update an assessment

___total.description: the total number of results (if available)

___url.description: The url of the job feed.

___app.description: the app that produced these actions

$eref.description: An array of career sites rolled up across all producing apps

___app.description: the app that is hosting these career sites

$eref.description: An array of panels rolled up across all producing apps

___total.description: the total number of results (if available)

_88sessionCreation.description: sourcing event for a user creating a new session at a web app such as a careers site

___campaignKind.description: Link out is used for job board postings

___referrer.description: the url (minus protocol) of some third party web site where the campaign is running, e.g. www.seek.co.nz, typically used with campaignKind == link out

_88onBoardedDate.description: The date on which the associated person completed onboarding.

_88tracker.description: The tracker, if any, associated with this application. This is fixed at the time that application is made.

_88hireDate.description: Per- HR-XML, The date on which the associated person was hired.

_88dutyEntryDate.description: Per- HR-XML, the date the employee or human resource actually begins work or enters on duty

_88since.description: If this application was fetched via a filter, the date-time when the application satisfied the filter (e.g., in a call to GET /applications/at/interview/ever, this would be the date the application first entered the interview phase

___amount.description: The monetary value of the object in which the amount is associated

___typeCode.description: A code classifying the type of remuneration (HR/XML)

$eref.description: a package of information about an application, e.g. a list of the well known fields and user defined items that should be returned

___defaultFlag.description: true if this view is the default view. At most one view should have this set

___label.description: a label for the view type

_88applicationModel.description: rules specific to a single job application (i.e., not candidate-scoped)

___job.description: the job application these rules apply to

___visible.description: can a resume be uploaded at all, and can existing resume be seen

___message.description: a message to help the candidate understand about uploading a resume - e.g. 'resume optional when a video is provided'

___mandatory.description: is the resume mandatory - implies visible == true

___accept.description: the allowable internet media types (mime types) for the resume, e.g. word and pdf files

___message.description: a text message to the candidate regarding their proposed edit, may include links

___showPrefixField.description: a simple way to hint that key vcard title field should be displayed

___someMandatory.description: a simple way to hint that key vcard fields (first name, last name, email address) are mandatory - probably will get replaced by more fine-grained scheme in the future

___allowedPrefixes.description: the allowable titles from the ATS. E.g.: [ Mr., Mrs., Ms., Dr. ]

___visible.description: is the candidate offered job notifications

___message.description: a message describing the job notification behavior that the candidate can expect

___selectedByDefault.description: sets the initial state of job notifications for new candidates

___tracker.description: just the same tracker that was passed in with the intent

_88gateForElement.description: a purpose that (e.g. 'apply') that this button is a gate for.

_88semantics.description: details about the semantics of this action that can be used by other apps. For example, knowledge that the action is used to apply for jobs may be useful if we want to (e.g.) prevent the user from applying unless they have completed some pre-qualification stage

_88purpose.description: values are: createAccount - this action can create the candidate's account. Applies only to general actions. apply - this action can apply for a job. Applies only to job actions. editDetails - this action can edit candidate details. Applies only to general actions.

___mayRequireSetupFlag.description: true if this action may provide a setup page (i.e. require some setup before it can be used)

___description.description: A description of what this action does

___actionName.description: A fixed name of this action, containing only lower case alpha, digits and '-' characters, length <= 30. The actionName is displayed to the user at setup time (e.g. to enable or disable the button) so it should make some sense to them. actionName should be unique within this app and scope, i.e. an app should never return more than one action with the same actionName as a possible job action.

_88notifications.description: whether this candidate wants to receive email alerts about new jobs

_88internalFlag.description: whether this candidate is an internal

$eref.description: the logical information needed to populate a button/control at runtime

_88gateState.description: for actions that are apply gates, true if the gate has been passed for this specific candidate + job, false if it was failed - this field should only be present when there is a result

_88name.description: fixed name for this action, containing only lower case alpha, digits and '-' characters, length <= 30

___name.description: fixed name for this action, containing only lower case alpha, digits and '-' characters, length <= 30

___textColor.description: the color that the button's text should be rendered in, in 6 character hex format without leading #, e.g. 00ff00

___disabled.description: true if the button/control should appear disabled, i.e. the action can be seen but not performed

___backgroundColor.description: the color that the button's background should be rendered in, in 6 character hex format without leading #, e.g. 00ff00

___imageUri.description: the url of an image to be displayed for this action (i.e. instead of a dynamically set up button)

___uri.description: the url that the button/control will redirect the user to when pressed, or use to populate an iframe inside a modal

___label.description: a string indicating what the action will do, used as the label on its button/control

$eref.description: the status of a previously launched upload

___failed.description: how many objects in the set have so far been unsuccessfully [operation]

___succeeded.description: how many objects in the set have so far been successfully [operation]

_88failureDetail.description: details of why a single object failed the crud operation (create or whatever)

___code.description: A code, e.g. on a job or job ad, that uniquely identifies the object

$eref.description: An array of all of the actions produced by a single app

___api.description: URL called to perform the api test

___message.description: Describes the outcome of the api test. Includes any exceptions if required

___success.description: true if the api test succeeds or false if the api test fails

_88canReuse.description: true if an assessment result on one job application can be reused when the same candidate makes another job application

_88candidateTitle.description: If present, a more specific label/title seen by candidates for this assessment type

_88isPassFail.description: whether this assessment results in an unambiguous pass/fail result, as stored in assessmentDetail.overallResult.passedIndicator

_88daysToExpireIsFixed.description: when canReuse == true, this determines whether users are allowed to override daysToExpire when configuring an assessment

_88userDescription.description: A description, worded for the user, of the purpose of this assessment. Markdown format. e.g.: Video interview captures a short video from the candidate.

_88appCommunicatesDirectlyToCandidate.description: Deprecated - all apps should communicate directly to candidates

_88key.description: the assessment app's unique (within that app) and immutable key for this assessment type

_88candidateDescription.description: If present, a more specific label/title seen by the candidate, of the purpose of this assessment. Markdown format. e.g.: Video interview is a short procedure you can complete on your own phone. We like to see who we're hiring.

_88sortable.description: whether assessment results can be sorted - if so, an API on the assessment app is called, passing an array of existing assessment IDs, so the app can return them in sorted order. Defaults to false if not present

_88daysToExpire.description: when canReuse == true, this is the default number of elapsed days before the previous assessment's result becomes no longer valid (as measured from the date that assessment was completed) - pass 0 to never expire

_88userTitle.description: A user-facing label/title for this assessment type

$eref.description: A schema for simple jobs, i.e. those that get uploaded in jobSets, typically to a public job board. Removes nuances such as status, internal candidates, etc.

___viewUri.description: URI to view the opening - see HR-XML

___shortSummary.description: A short (up to 75 characters) and enticing call to action for candidates for this job

___description.description: The job's description. Job descriptions are formatted using the safe subset of markdown (see documentation for GET /jobs/{}/description)

___applyUri.description: URI of the page where a candidate applies - see HR-XML

___closeDate.description: the date on which applications are scheduled to close

___links.description: an array of links to resources (videos etc.) that are relevant to the job

___datePosted.description: the date on which the job was advertised/posted - downstream job boards may use or ignore

___title.description: A short phrase describing the position as it would be listed on a business card or in a company directory

$eref.description: an assessment strip for a single application

___application.description: the application this strip is for

$eref.description: details of a a single category, identified by id or key (if a well-known category)

___message.description: a message to help the candidate/user when entering values for the category - e.g. 'tell us the top 4 stores you really want to work at'

___mandatory.description: whether a value for the category is mandatory

___canMultiSelect.description: true if an object can have multiple values for this category

___leafSelectionOnly.description: true if an object can have only leaf selections for this category

___name.description: the user visible name for this category

___key.description: used to identify categories that are well-known, i.e. agreed on by all apps. User-defined categories don't have a key

_88selectedId.description: the id of a choice that the user selected

___value.description: json representation of a number item's current value

_88pickChoice.description: the name of a choice that the user selected

___choice.description: the name of a choice that the user selected

___subItems.description: items unlocked based on a cascade choice

___value.description: json representation of a boolean item's current value
json representation of a string item's current value
json representation of a date item's current value

$eref.description: A jcard holding personal details, as per https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7095
details for a previously uploaded file

_88via.description: the mechanism via which the file was uploaded - either 'device' or the fqdn of a cloud storage platform (e.g. dropbox.com)

_88mediaType.description: keep in synch with the trait document_asStream

___md5.description: hash of the file's binary content

___dateUploaded.description: the date and time the file was uploaded

___preSignedUri.description: pre-signed link as per http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/sigv4-query-string-auth.html to access the raw data. Includes file name as the trailing component so that browsers name the download correctly.
